required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predictive Model of Recovery in Patients With Chronic Nonspecific Neck Pain Undergoing Manual Therapy and Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Modelo Preditivo Para os Resultados de Sucesso Com um Programa Combinado de Terapia Manual e exercício em indivíduos Com Dor Cervical crónica de Origem não-especifica

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to develop a predictive model to identify which patients with chronic nonspecific neck pain are more likely to benefit from manual therapy and exercise program, or usual care.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Neck Pain Intensity as measured by the Numeric pain rating scale (NRPS) at 3 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: The change will be defined on the Minimal Clinically Important Difference in treatment response defined as a decrease of ≥2 point in NRPS (range: 0 - 10 points).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Neck Pain Intensity as measured by the Numeric pain rating scale (NRPS) at 6 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: The change will be defined on the Minimal Clinically Important Difference in treatment response defined as a decrease of ≥2 point in NRPS (range: 0 - 10 points).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Neck Pain Intensity as measured by the Numeric pain rating scale (NRPS) at follow-up 3 months.
primary_outcome.description: The change will be defined on the Minimal Clinically Important Difference in treatment response defined as a decrease of ≥2 point in NRPS (range: 0 - 10 points).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Neck Disability as measured by the Neck Disability Index (NDI) at 3 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: The change will be defined on the Minimal Clinically Important Difference in treatment response defined as a decrease of ≥27% in NDI (range: 0-50 and higher scores are indicative of more disability).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Neck Disability as measured by the Neck Disability Index (NDI) at 6 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: The change will be defined on the Minimal Clinically Important Difference in treatment response defined as a decrease of ≥27% in NDI (range: 0-50 and higher scores are indicative of more disability).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Neck Disability as measured by the Neck Disability Index (NDI) at follow-up 3 months.
primary_outcome.description: The change will be defined on the Minimal Clinically Important Difference in treatment response defined as a decrease of ≥27% in NDI (range: 0-50 and higher scores are indicative of more disability).

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Important Treatment response in global perceived recovery as measured by Patient's Global Impression of Change Scale at 3 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The clinically Important treatment response in global perceived recovery was defined as a value of ≥5 in Patient's Global Impression of Change Scale (range: 1-7 Likert Scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Important Treatment response in global perceived recovery as measured by Patient's Global Impression of Change Scale at 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The clinically Important treatment response in global perceived recovery was defined as a value of ≥5 in Patient's Global Impression of Change Scale (range: 1-7 Likert Scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Important Treatment response in global perceived recovery as measured by Patient's Global Impression of Change Scale at follow-up 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: The clinically Important treatment response in global perceived recovery was defined as a value of ≥5 in Patient's Global Impression of Change Scale (range: 1-7 Likert Scale)

intervention.description: Participants in this group will receive a 6-weeks program of mobilization and progressive exercise for the neck flexors, 2 times a week.
Participants in this group will receive usual care in physiotherapy during the 6-weeks period.

overall_official.affiliation: Nova Medical School | Faculdade de Ciências Médicas - Universidade Nova de Lisboa
